verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, That there be some of them that stand here, which shall not taste of death, till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.
verses.ct: Then he told them, "Truly I tell you, some of you standing here will not die before you see the kingdom of God arriving with power."

verses.kjv: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter, and James, and John, and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them.
verses.ct: 6 days later, Jesus took Peter, James, and John and led them up a high mountain where they were completely alone. There his appearance was transformed right in front of them.

verses.kjv: And his raiment became shining, exceeding white as snow; so as no fuller on earth can white them.
verses.ct: His clothing became dazzling, intensely white — whiter than anyone on earth could ever bleach them.

verses.kjv: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.
verses.ct: Then Elias appeared along with Moses, and the two of them were having a conversation with Jesus.

verses.kjv: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
verses.ct: Peter spoke up and said to Jesus, "Rabbi, it's wonderful that we're here! Let us put up 3 shelters — one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elias."

verses.kjv: For he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.
verses.ct: He didn't really know what to say because they were absolutely terrified.

verses.kjv: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them: and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
verses.ct: Then a cloud came and covered them, and a voice spoke from the cloud: "This is my beloved Son. Listen to him."

verses.kjv: And suddenly, when they had looked round about, they saw no man any more, save Jesus only with themselves.
verses.ct: All at once, when they looked around, they no longer saw anyone except Jesus alone with them.

verses.kjv: And as they came down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen, till the Son of man were risen from the dead.
verses.ct: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus instructed them not to tell anyone what they had witnessed until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.

verses.kjv: And they kept that saying with themselves, questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean.
verses.ct: They kept this to themselves, but they debated with each other about what "rising from the dead" meant.

verses.kjv: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?
verses.ct: They asked him, "Why do the teachers of the law say that Elias has to come first?"

verses.kjv: And he answered and told them, Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.
verses.ct: He replied, "Elias does indeed come first and restores everything. But then why is it written that the Son of Man must suffer greatly and be treated with contempt?"

verses.kjv: But I say unto you, That Elias is indeed come, and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed, as it is written of him.
verses.ct: "But I tell you that Elias has already come, and people did whatever they wanted to him, just as the Scriptures said about him."

verses.kjv: And when he came to his disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.
verses.ct: When they returned to the other disciples, they found a large crowd gathered around them, with the teachers of the law arguing with them.

verses.kjv: And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running to him saluted him.
verses.ct: As soon as the whole crowd spotted Jesus, they were completely amazed and ran over to greet him.

verses.kjv: And he asked the scribes, What question ye with them?
verses.ct: He asked the teachers of the law, "What are you arguing with them about?"

verses.kjv: And one of the multitude answered and said, Master, I have brought unto thee my son, which hath a dumb spirit;
verses.ct: A man in the crowd answered, "Teacher, I brought my son to you. He has a spirit that has made him unable to speak."

verses.kjv: And wheresoever he taketh him, he teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out; and they could not.
verses.ct: "Whenever it seizes him, it throws him to the ground. He foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and his body goes rigid. I asked your disciples to drive it out, but they couldn't do it."

verses.kjv: He answereth him, and saith, O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him unto me.
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "What an unbelieving generation! How long must I stay with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him to me."

verses.kjv: And they brought him unto him: and when he saw him, straightway the spirit tare him; and he fell on the ground, and wallowed foaming.
verses.ct: So they brought the boy to him. The moment the spirit saw Jesus, it threw the boy into a violent convulsion. He fell on the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.

verses.kjv: And he asked his father, How long is it ago since this came unto him? And he said, Of a child.
verses.ct: Jesus asked the boy's father, "How long has this been happening to him?" The father said, "Since he was a small child."

verses.kjv: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire, and into the waters, to destroy him: but if thou canst do any thing, have compassion on us, and help us.
verses.ct: "It has often thrown him into fire and into water, trying to kill him. But if you can do anything at all, please have pity on us and help us."

verses.kjv: Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe, all things are possible to him that believeth.
verses.ct: Jesus said to him, "'If you can'? Everything is possible for the person who believes."

verses.kjv: And straightway the father of the child cried out, and said with tears, Lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.
verses.ct: Immediately the boy's father cried out with tears, "Lord, I do believe! Help me overcome my doubt!"

verses.kjv: When Jesus saw that the people came running together, he rebuked the foul spirit, saying unto him, Thou dumb and deaf spirit, I charge thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him.
verses.ct: When Jesus noticed the crowd rushing toward them, he commanded the evil spirit, "You spirit that causes deafness and an inability to speak — I order you, come out of him and never enter him again!"

verses.kjv: And the spirit cried, and rent him sore, and came out of him: and he was as one dead; insomuch that many said, He is dead.
verses.ct: The spirit screamed, threw the boy into severe convulsions, and came out. The boy looked so lifeless that most of the people said, "He's dead."

verses.kjv: But Jesus took him by the hand, and lifted him up; and he arose.
verses.ct: But Jesus took him by the hand and helped him up, and he stood on his feet.

verses.kjv: And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out?
verses.ct: After Jesus had gone inside a house, his disciples asked him privately, "Why weren't we able to drive it out?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, This kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.
verses.ct: He told them, "This kind can only be driven out through prayer and fasting."

verses.kjv: And they departed thence, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should know it.
verses.ct: They left that area and traveled through Galilee. Jesus didn't want anyone to know where they were,

verses.kjv: For he taught his disciples, and said unto them, The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men, and they shall kill him; and after that he is killed, he shall rise the third day.
verses.ct: because he was teaching his disciples. He told them, "The Son of Man is going to be handed over to people who will kill him. But 3 days after being killed, he will rise again."

verses.kjv: But they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.
verses.ct: They didn't understand what he was saying, and they were too afraid to ask him about it.

verses.kjv: And he came to Capernaum: and being in the house he asked them, What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way?
verses.ct: They arrived in Capernaum, and once they were inside the house, he asked them, "What were you arguing about on the road?"

verses.kjv: But they held their peace: for by the way they had disputed among themselves, who should be the greatest.
verses.ct: They stayed silent, because on the road they had been arguing about which of them was the greatest.

verses.kjv: And he sat down, and called the twelve, and saith unto them, If any man desire to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant of all.
verses.ct: Jesus sat down, called the 12 over, and said to them, "If anyone wants to be first, that person must be the very last and the servant of everyone else."

verses.kjv: And he took a child, and set him in the midst of them: and when he had taken him in his arms, he said unto them,
verses.ct: He brought a little child and had the child stand among them. Then he picked the child up in his arms and said to them,

verses.kjv: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.
verses.ct: "Whoever welcomes one of these little children in my name welcomes me. And whoever welcomes me isn't just welcoming me, but the One who sent me."

verses.kjv: And John answered him, saying, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name, and he followeth not us: and we forbad him, because he followeth not us.
verses.ct: John said to him, "Teacher, we saw someone driving out demons using your name, and we tried to stop him because he isn't part of our group."

verses.kjv: But Jesus said, Forbid him not: for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name, that can lightly speak evil of me.
verses.ct: But Jesus said, "Don't stop him. No one who performs a miracle in my name will be able to turn around and speak against me."

verses.kjv: For he that is not against us is on our part.
verses.ct: "Whoever is not against us is for us."

verses.kjv: For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because ye belong to Christ, verily I say unto you, he shall not lose his reward.
verses.ct: "Truly I tell you, anyone who gives you even a cup of water because you belong to Christ will certainly not lose their reward."

verses.kjv: And whosoever shall offend one of these little ones that believe in me, it is better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he were cast into the sea.
verses.ct: "But if anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for that person to have a massive millstone tied around their neck and be thrown into the sea."

verses.kjv: And if thy hand offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter into life maimed, than having two hands to go into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:
verses.ct: "If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It's better to enter life with one hand than to have both hands and be thrown into hell, into the fire that can never be put out,"

verses.kjv: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
verses.ct: "where the worms never die and the fire is never put out."

verses.kjv: And if thy foot offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter halt into life, than having two feet to be cast into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:
verses.ct: "If your foot causes you to sin, cut it off. It's better to enter life crippled than to have both feet and be thrown into hell, into the fire that can never be put out,"

verses.kjv: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
verses.ct: "where the worms never die and the fire is never put out."

verses.kjv: And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out: it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye, than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire:
verses.ct: "If your eye causes you to sin, tear it out. It's better to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than to have both eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell,"

verses.kjv: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
verses.ct: "where the worms never die and the fire is never put out."

verses.kjv: For every one shall be salted with fire, and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt.
verses.ct: "Everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be salted with salt."

verses.kjv: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his saltness, wherewith will ye season it? Have salt in yourselves, and have peace one with another.
verses.ct: "Salt is useful, but if salt loses its flavor, how can you make it salty again? Have salt among yourselves, and live at peace with one another."
